items.to_string:
Title
Update SPA deployment Jenkins pipeline to deploy model from SageMaker model registry

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages SPA deployments, I need the ability to deploy models from the SageMaker model registry instead of directly from S3 so that model versioning and management are improved.

Acceptance Criteria

When a deployment is triggered, the Jenkins pipeline retrieves the model from the SageMaker model registry.
The pipeline no longer pulls the model directly from S3.
Deployment status and errors are logged.

Title
Clean up SPA repo and re-enable Black and Pylint GitHub Actions checks

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains the SPA codebase, I need the ability to enforce code quality by re-enabling Black and Pylint checks in GitHub Actions so that code standards are maintained automatically.

Acceptance Criteria

When a pull request is opened or updated, Black and Pylint checks run automatically via GitHub Actions.
The SPA repo is cleaned up to ensure these checks pass.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26808
BIP-25959 Support Development of Smart Pension Automation Use Case

As a bip ai engineer who automates API testing using Bruno cli, I need the ability to securely authenticate using Okta service accounts so that tests can run in CI/CD pipelines without exposing user credentials or relying on manual login steps.

 

When a Bruno CLI test is triggered in the pipeline, the service can authenticate using an Okta-issued service account token to access protected APIs.
When authentication succeeds, the Bruno CLI can send API requests to endpoints protected by Okta without manual intervention.

As a BIP AI engineer who ensures system stability after infrastructure changes, I need the ability to validate Crossplane composition readiness and confirm existing domains continue to function after new domain additions so that we can safely catch regressions and prevent breaking deployments.

When a smoke test pipeline is triggered, it must include a stage that queries the Crossplane API and confirms that the relevant composition is in a Ready state before proceeding.
When the Crossplane check passes, the next stage must load a list of previously registered domains (excluding newly added ones) and verify that they are accessible and behaving correctly using Playwright.
The implementation must include or reference a deltas file or similar mechanism that identifies which domains are newly added vs pre-existing.
The Playwright checks must log success or failure for each domain and fail the pipeline if any existing domains are non-functional.

Value Statement
As a ML Engineer who promotes KB between environments, I need the ability to determine and document the KB promotion process between pre-prod and prod so that there is a set promotion process to use.

Acceptance Criteria
When a user wants to promote a KB from pre-prod to prod the user has the ability to consult a piece of documentation in confluence that outlines the steps required.

Value Statement
As a ML engineer I want to add a knowledge to a tenant agent so that they can access and utilize the relevant knowledge base to answer questions, resolve issues, or provide guidance based on the information in the knowledgebase.

Acceptance Criteria:
When a tenant wants to use their agent, they have access to their relevant knowledge. Does this need to be done through console or a notebook?

There's an existing tenant agent and an existing knowledge base. There's functionality to integrate the KB into the agent, that's what we want to do here in dev environment. Reach out to Saumil with questions

Title
Update Dockerfiles to use BIA docker registry base images for Nexus image users

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains Dockerfiles in TERA, mlkit, tenant resources, and cookiecutter repos, I need the ability to update base image references to the BIA docker registry so that image builds continue to work after access to the C&P docker registry is removed.

Acceptance Criteria

When a Dockerfile uses a Nexus base image, the image path is updated to use the BIA docker registry (container-registry-bia.<env>.bip.va.gov).
Any separate image build pipelines are updated to use the BIA docker registry.
Documentation is updated to reflect the new image registry path.
Image builds succeed using the updated base image references.

Title
Coordinate Crossplane Lambda deployment to automate promotion of Bedrock agents

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports infrastructure automation, I need to coordinate with the infra team on Crossplane Lambda deployment so that AWS Bedrock agent resources can be promoted automatically using IAC.

Acceptance Criteria

Infra team’s Crossplane Lambda deployment requirements are gathered and understood.
Support is provided to enable IAC-based promotion of Bedrock agent resources.
Any issues or blockers are documented and communicated.
Confirmation that Crossplane Lambda deployment works as intended for agent promotion.

Title
Support infra team’s agent promotion via IAC to enable automated Bedrock agent deployment

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who collaborates with the infra team, I need to support and test agent promotion using infrastructure as code (IAC) with a realistic AWS Bedrock agent use case so that automated deployment processes are reliable and meet tenant needs.

Acceptance Criteria

Infra team’s IAC agent promotion process is tested with a realistic AWS Bedrock agent use case.
Any issues or gaps identified during testing are documented and communicated.
Confirmation that agent promotion works as expected using IAC.
Recommendations for improvements are provided if needed.

Title
Enable Bedrock logging in Stage environment to support usage monitoring

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages platform environments, I need to enable AWS Bedrock logging in the Stage environment so that usage can be monitored and dashboarded consistently across environments.

Acceptance Criteria

When Bedrock is used in the Stage environment, logging is enabled and captures relevant usage data.
Logging configuration in Stage matches the setup in the Dev environment.
Logs are accessible for future monitoring and dashboarding work.

Title
Enable Bedrock logging in preprod environment to support usage monitoring

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages platform environments, I need to enable AWS Bedrock logging in the preprod environment so that usage can be monitored and dashboarded consistently across environments.

Acceptance Criteria

When Bedrock is used in the preprod environment, logging is enabled and captures relevant usage data.
Logging configuration in preprod matches the setup in the dev environment.
Logs are accessible for future monitoring and dashboarding work.

Title
Add Bedrock invocation graphs to MLOps dashboard to enable usage monitoring

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who monitors platform usage, I need the ability to view Bedrock invocation graphs on the MLOps dashboard so that I can track and analyze Bedrock service usage.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user accesses the MLOps dashboard, Bedrock invocation graphs are visible.
Graphs display relevant invocation metrics (e.g., counts, trends).
Data updates automatically to reflect recent usage.

Title
Create simple AWS Bedrock agent as tenant to identify and document potential issues

Value Statement
As a BIP AI engineer who supports AWS Bedrock development, I need to work through the process of creating a simple Bedrock agent and document any issues encountered so that future tenants can avoid common pitfalls and onboarding is smoother.

Acceptance Criteria

A simple AWS Bedrock agent is created using tenant access.
Any issues or blockers encountered during the process are documented.
Documentation is updated to include steps taken and recommendations for future tenants.

Title
Evaluate BIH self-service Lambda creation for agent development to assess tenant feasibility

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who develops Bedrock agents, I need to use the BIH self-service Lambda creation process as part of agent development so that I can determine if this approach is feasible and effective for tenant use.

Acceptance Criteria

BIH self-service Lambda creation is used during agent development as a tenant.
Any issues or limitations encountered are documented.
Feasibility and recommendations for tenant use are summarized in documentation.

items.from_string: Use self-service lambda creation as part of agent dev, determine feasibility for tenants

items.from_string:
Title
Update parameter and secret names to include SageMaker domain IDs for IAM policy compliance.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages AWS resources, I need the ability to update parameter store and secrets manager names to include SageMaker domain IDs so that they are compliant with IAM policies and ensure proper access control.

Acceptance Criteria
When parameters in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store are updated, their names include the new SageMaker domain IDs.
When secrets in AWS Secrets Manager are updated, their names include the new SageMaker domain IDs.
The update process ensures no disruption to existing workflows or applications relying on these parameters and secrets.
A script or process is provided to automate the renaming and validation of updated names.
Validation
Verify that all relevant parameters and secrets are updated with the new SageMaker domain IDs.
Test IAM policies to confirm access control works as expected with the updated names.
Ensure applications and workflows using the parameters and secrets continue to function without errors.
items.to_string:
Initiative: As a BIP AI MLOps developer, I need to create a Jenkins pipeline to attach LCC scripts to staging domains so that when users start a JupyterLab space their environments are configured correctly for development. There are already Jenkins pipelines in dev and preprod to attach LCC scripts, and these pipelines need to be replicated for stage. This ticket is created based on tenant request from https://jira.devops.va.gov/browse/BIPAIS-135.


AC:
Jenkins pipeline to attach LCC to stage domains is created.
Jenkins pipeline is run against all (8) stage domains and validated.

items.from_string:
Title: Implement BIP-AI RBAC for tooling ArgoCD to allow management of applications

Value Statement As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I need to implement RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) for tooling ArgoCD, so that I can enable proper access management and security controls for application deployment and management within the BIP-AI platform. Description This story involves implementing comprehensive RBAC policies for the tooling ArgoCD instance to ensure proper access control, security boundaries, and operational governance for application management for BIP AI Infrastructure engineers. The implementation will follow security best practices and integrate with existing authentication and authorization systems.

A/C: When I implement RBAC policies for tooling ArgoCD, then I need to: Define appropriate roles and permissions for different user types (developers, operators, administrators) Configure RBAC policies that align with BIP-AI security requirements Implement proper access controls for application management operations Follow existing RBAC patterns and conventions used in the BIP platform When I configure the RBAC integration, then it needs to: Integrate with existing authentication systems (OIDC, SSO) Support fine-grained permissions for different environments (dev, staging, prod) Enable proper application lifecycle management controls Restrict access based on user roles and project boundaries When I test the RBAC implementation, then it needs to: Successfully authenticate and authorize users based on their roles Properly enforce permission boundaries for application operations Handle different user scenarios (create, read, update, delete applications) Work correctly in ephemeral environment for validation When I validate the RBAC functionality, then it needs to: Demonstrate proper access control enforcement Show correct permission inheritance and role mapping Handle edge cases and unauthorized access attempts appropriately Maintain audit trails for access and operations Definition of Done: RBAC policies implemented and configured for tooling ArgoCD Integration with authentication systems completed Comprehensive testing performed in ephemeral environment PR created with approvals from Engineering team Documentation updated with RBAC configuration and usage patterns
items.to_string:
Story: Implement Multi-Model Bedrock Inference Profiles in Dev Environment
User Story As a BIP AI Platform Infrastructure Engineer, I want to deploy and validate multi-model Bedrock inference profiles in our dev environment, so that tenants can request access to multiple AI models through a single declarative configuration.

Business Value

Multi-Model Efficiency: Enable tenants to access multiple AI models (Claude, GPT, etc.) through unified inference profiles
Production Readiness: Validate prototype in real dev environment before stage/prod deployment
Tenant Self-Service: Allow tenants to specify which models they need through simple YAML configuration
Cost Control: Implement proper model access controls and tenant-specific model allowlists
Acceptance Criteria

AC1: Multi-Model Configuration

 Deploy composition that creates separate inference profiles per model requested
 Validate tenant model requests against environment-specific allowlists
 Support both single and multi-model requests through bedrockModelsRequested parameter
AC2: Dev Environment Deployment

 Deploy to dev environment with real tenant namespace integration
 Validate against actual environment configs and model lists
 Test with multiple tenants having different model access permissions
AC3: Model Access Validation

 Confirm inference profiles are created only for tenant-allowed models
 Test model invocation through bedrock-runtime API for each created profile
 Validate proper error handling for unauthorized model requests
AC4: Production-Ready Implementation

 Implement proper resource naming conventions (inferenceProfileName-modelShortName)
 Apply complete tagging strategy including tenant-specific tags
 Ensure proper cleanup when tenant model access is revoked
Definition of Done

 Multi-model inference profiles successfully created in dev environment
 All model-specific profiles can be invoked via bedrock-runtime API
 Tenant isolation and model access controls verified
 Resource lifecycle tested (create, update, delete scenarios)
 Ready for stage environment promotion

Title
Organize SPA GitHub repository to improve usability.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who works with the SPA GitHub repository, I need the ability to organize and clean up the repository so that it is easier to navigate, maintain, and collaborate effectively.

Acceptance Criteria
When the repository is reviewed, unused or outdated files are identified and removed.
When the repository is organized, files and folders are structured logically based on functionality or purpose.

Validation

Confirm that all outdated or unused files have been removed.
Ensure that the updated documentation accurately reflects the new structure.

Title
Update SageMaker lifecycle configuration script to use user profile security group.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who sets up SageMaker environments, I need the ability to use my user profile security group by default in the lifecycle configuration script so that I can simplify environment setup and reduce manual configuration steps.

Acceptance Criteria
When a SageMaker domain is created or updated, the lifecycle configuration script automatically uses the user's profile security group by default.
The script provides clear error messages if the user profile security group is unavailable or misconfigured.
Validation
Test the lifecycle configuration script with various user profiles to confirm it correctly applies the user profile security group.
Verify that error handling and messaging are clear and actionable for tenants.

Acceptance Criteria

The script provides clear error messages if the user profile security group is unavailable or misconfigured.

items.from_string:
Value Statement: As a MLOps Engineer on the BIP AI Shared Services team who provides ML tutorials to tenants, I need the ability to make sure all examples use SM wrapped classes so that tenants are encouraged to use them by default.

Acceptance Criteria: When a user views any of the tutorials in the tenant resource repo, all tutorials use SM wrapped classes, instead of third party libraries (sklearn, etc.) when possible
items.to_string:
Title
Update parameter and secret names to include SageMaker domain IDs for IAM policy compliance.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages AWS resources, I need the ability to update parameter store and secrets manager names to include SageMaker domain IDs so that they are compliant with IAM policies and ensure proper access control.

Acceptance Criteria
When parameters in AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store are updated, their names include the new SageMaker domain IDs.
When secrets in AWS Secrets Manager are updated, their names include the new SageMaker domain IDs.
The update process ensures no disruption to existing workflows or applications relying on these parameters and secrets.
A script or process is provided to automate the renaming and validation of updated names.
Validation
Verify that all relevant parameters and secrets are updated with the new SageMaker domain IDs.
Test IAM policies to confirm access control works as expected with the updated names.
Ensure applications and workflows using the parameters and secrets continue to function without errors.
This issue is cloned by BIP-26572
This issue is cloned by BIP-26617

items.from_string: This issue is cloned by BIP-26572

As a cloud engineer I need to research how to migrate jenkins Jobs and pipelines from one instance of jenkins to another, so the BIP AI team can decommission mlmats Jenkins instances.
A/C:
A markdown document is created with a plan on how to do this, this document can be stored in github bip-ai-docs repo
items.to_string:
As an Infrastructure engineer, I need to migrate all Jenkins pipelines from the MLMATS Jenkins instances to their respective BIP-AI instances, so that we can complete our transition off MLMATS namespaced resources.

Acceptance Criteria (A/C):
- Create or find existing automation to migrate Jenkins pipelines from one instance to another.
- For the Stage and Preprod environments, all existing pipelines are migrated to their respective BIP-AI versions.
- For the Dev environment, only migrate the following pipelines:

> Note for TRA's: This list needs to be added to Jira after the team is given more time to identify the pipelines they want to keep in Dev.

items.from_string:
As an engineer, I want to assist the deployment of Aria into the gateway so that users have a working Aria chatbot to interact with. 

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- When a user goes to the gateway, the user has the ability to interact with Aria.
items.to_string:
As an engineer, I want the API to support saving and retrieving conversation history using Langchain, so that users have the ability to pull up past conversations from Aria.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- When a user interacts with Aria, the user's conversation is saved persistently using Langchain.
- This enables users to access and review their conversation history.

**Benefit:**
- Users gain continuity and can reference previous interactions with Aria, improving usability and experience.

items.from_string:
## Overview
Refactor the ARIA API-related code to make it more reusable and easily extensible. The new API structure should allow engineers to easily understand, extend, and configure functionality with minimal code changes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- ARIA API codebase is refactored into reusable modules/components this includes cache, users and logging
- API behavior is easily configurable
- Clear documentation within code for future engineers
- Code is structured to allow easy expansion and extension
- API is fully functional post-refactor

## Value
This enables a more maintainable, understandable, and extensible API that can evolve with future needs and is straightforward for engineers to work with.
items.to_string:

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- When a user goes to the gateway, the user has the ability to interact with Aria.

1) Pull data from github and upload into s3

2) Kick off ingestion job that will refresh the Knowledge Base

items.to_string:
Title
Connect SCC API to Bedrock Knowledge Base for streamlined data access.

Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who needs to integrate external APIs with the Bedrock Knowledge Base, I need the ability to connect the SCC API to the Bedrock Knowledge Base so that I can retrieve and utilize relevant knowledge base data efficiently for my application workflows.

Acceptance Criteria
When the SCC API is configured with the Bedrock Knowledge Base, the user has the ability to retrieve data from the knowledge base. 

Validation:
Verify that data can be successfully retrieved from the Bedrock Knowledge Base from the SCC API.
